title: CAPs-Based Mathematics Pedagogy Workshop for Pre-Service Mathematics Teachers: Advanced Applications of Equations, Graphs, and Statistics

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics education theory (algebra, geometry, statistics), classroom management experience, problem-solving skills in mathematics, and graph interpretation abilities
context.additional_context: Recreates actual classroom situations in VR simulation environments, allowing repeated listening to CAPs content (formula derivation processes, problem-solving cases, statistical analysis methods) via personal mobile devices. Supports customized activity design for each math concept.

learning_goals: Preservice teachers can design instructional strategies using CAPs to improve the understanding of math concepts (equations, graphs, statistics) by 20% or more for students with special needs.

Learners can apply math formulas and problem-solving strategies acquired through CAPs in VR simulations to execute three or more differentiated math teaching methods (visual modeling, step-by-step problem-solving, real-world connections).

Participants can propose two or more strategies to enhance student engagement (collaborative learning, personalized feedback, gamification elements) in their CAPs-based lessons through peer evaluation.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
